summary: This document is an email chain from March 2021 between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) and law enforcement personnel (FBI/NYPD) regarding the review and preservation of electronic communications for the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses compliance with Justice Manual guidelines and scheduling a call to coordinate the process.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain and the federal criminal case for which electronic communications must be reviewed and preserved by the prosecution team.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, instructing FBI and NYPD personnel on the requirement to review and preserve e-communications related to the Maxwell case per Justice Manual guidelines.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: A member of the joint task force involved in the Maxwell investigation, indicating availability for a scheduling call regarding e-communications review.

connections.person2: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
connections.description: Working together as part of the prosecution team on the Ghislaine Maxwell case, coordinating on legal procedures for evidence preservation.
The AUSA is part of the team prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Email Coordination for E-Communications Review
events.description: An email chain among prosecutors and law enforcement to schedule a call and discuss plans for preserving and reviewing electronic communications related to the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution, as required by Justice Manual guidelines.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

events.title: Initial E-Communications Policy Email
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an initial email to FBI and NYPD personnel outlining the requirement to review Justice Manual guidelines and preserve all substantive e-communications and communications with witnesses for the Maxwell case.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The prosecution team for Ghislaine Maxwell was actively coordinating in March 2021 to preserve and review electronic communications as required by federal guidelines (Justice Manual 9-5.004).
The requirement included preserving all substantive e-communications from prosecution team members and all communications with lay witnesses, regardless of content.
The email chain shows collaboration between Assistant United States Attorneys and a joint NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force detective on case preparation.
The correspondence is focused on procedural compliance for evidence handling in an ongoing federal criminal prosecution.
